page.title: 05ALL SAINTS CHURCH KEMPSTON
page.content: There has been a Christian Church on the site of All Saints Kempston since {Saxon times.}William the Conquerer's niece Judith rebuilt the church here. Now with its three aisles, stained glass windows and wood carvings, it is a beautiful light church attended by over a hundred people at the three {Sunday services.}About fifty children go to{Sunday School.}An experienced team ring the 10 bells, an organist and choir lead the worship and flower arrangements and beautiful embroidery decorate the church. Canon Kenneth Habermehl has been{vicar for the past 20 years. Through baptisms, weddings and funerals, visiting the sick and distressed and serving on local committees the church ministers to the people of Kempston. The{church hall}built in 1970 is heavily used all year.
